channel.title: (deathlypvpz) message!
channel.description:
Hi,how i make this message ?
Main Owner player has logged in?
I can't find it anywhere could someone help me please? :)

item.title: (deathlypvpz) message!
item.dc:creator: @Flame3 John
item.description:
@Flame3 wrote:

Be more respectful to those who take the time to help you; nobody is required to assist you at all.

Read full topic

item.title: (deathlypvpz) message!
item.dc:creator: @imback4more imback4more
item.description:
@imback4more wrote:

Go to your client.java (sometimes some servers just says “client” some dont have java,but its file is java)
find “main-owner” or “co-owner” or something like "if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase"
and you’ll find a code somewhat like this

if(playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""+ Config.OWNER +"")) { for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) { if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j]; getDH().sendDialogues(28, npcType); c2.sendMessage("<col=63487><shad=15007744><img=3> [Main-Owner] <img=3> "+ Config.OWNER +" JUST LOGGED ON"); } } }

The “<col=63487>” is a color code to what the chat color will be.
The “<shad=15007744>” will be like a background color,it will jsut add up with the 1st color and mix them up.I like this code together.I don’t mind if you use it too
The "<img=3> " from both sides is the symbol of the crown.
You can change the “[Main-Owner]” But make sure you have those bars around the word,so it means its a type of tag rank.
The " “+ Config.OWNER +” " means when you change the owner name to yours,from your previous post I seen earlier.It’ll automatically show the player name.You can change it to a different name.It just means once you change the owner name from the other file.It’ll automatically respond to the “+ Config.OWNER +” to say that the owner is online.So remember when you changed that deathly name to your server name? When you go scroll down it should show owner= blah blah blah and when you change that name.The “+ Config.OWNER +” will respond witht the name you changed on the other file.Otherwise just change it to a player name.

Read full topic
